title: Q1: Question 4
content: Modern interfaces use what bit depth?
explanation:
Expert Explanation: An audio interface acts as the bridge between analog gear (microphones/guitars) and the computer. It performs A/D conversion for recording and D/A conversion for playback to monitors.

"Latency is the enemy of performance."
- Studio Basics

expert_quote.text: Latency is the enemy of performance.
expert_quote.author: Studio Basics

expert_explanation: An audio interface acts as the bridge between analog gear (microphones/guitars) and the computer. It performs A/D conversion for recording and D/A conversion for playback to monitors.

title: Q2: Question 10
content: A 25-key MIDI controller has how many octaves?
explanation:
Expert Explanation: MIDI controllers do not generate sound themselves; they send data (Note On, Velocity, Pitch) to software instruments in the DAW. Mod wheels and faders provide expressive control over parameters.

"Velocity sensitivity brings the human element back to digital keys."
- Keyboard Magazine

expert_quote.text: Velocity sensitivity brings the human element back to digital keys.
expert_quote.author: Keyboard Magazine

expert_explanation: MIDI controllers do not generate sound themselves; they send data (Note On, Velocity, Pitch) to software instruments in the DAW. Mod wheels and faders provide expressive control over parameters.

title: Q3: Question 5
explanation:
Expert Explanation: Signal flow describes the path audio takes. A standard insert chain processes signal in series (one after another), meaning the output of the EQ feeds the input of the Compressor.

"Busses are the highways of your mix."
- Routing Analogy

expert_quote.text: Busses are the highways of your mix.
expert_quote.author: Routing Analogy

expert_explanation: Signal flow describes the path audio takes. A standard insert chain processes signal in series (one after another), meaning the output of the EQ feeds the input of the Compressor.

title: Q4: Question 1
content: XLR cables have how many pins?
explanation:
Expert Explanation: Balanced cables (XLR, TRS) use three conductors (Hot, Cold, Ground) to cancel out noise interference using phase cancellation. Unbalanced cables (TS, RCA) are susceptible to hum over long runs.

"A bad cable can ruin a perfect take."
- Live Sound Reality

expert_quote.text: A bad cable can ruin a perfect take.
expert_quote.author: Live Sound Reality

expert_explanation: Balanced cables (XLR, TRS) use three conductors (Hot, Cold, Ground) to cancel out noise interference using phase cancellation. Unbalanced cables (TS, RCA) are susceptible to hum over long runs.

title: Q5: Question 9
explanation:
Expert Explanation: USB is the most common consumer interface connection, but Thunderbolt offers significantly higher bandwidth and lower latency (round-trip delay), making it preferred for professional studios with high track counts.

"USB is convenient, but Thunderbolt is robust."
- Interface Tech

expert_quote.text: USB is convenient, but Thunderbolt is robust.
expert_quote.author: Interface Tech

expert_explanation: USB is the most common consumer interface connection, but Thunderbolt offers significantly higher bandwidth and lower latency (round-trip delay), making it preferred for professional studios with high track counts.

title: Q6: Question 1
explanation:
Expert Explanation: Edison's Phonograph (1877) was the first machine to record and reproduce sound. It used a stylus to indent sound waves onto a rotating tinfoil (later wax) cylinder, mechanically preserving the waveform.

"History sounds better because we forget the noise."
- Nostalgia Check

expert_quote.text: History sounds better because we forget the noise.
expert_quote.author: Nostalgia Check

expert_explanation: Edison's Phonograph (1877) was the first machine to record and reproduce sound. It used a stylus to indent sound waves onto a rotating tinfoil (later wax) cylinder, mechanically preserving the waveform.

title: Q7: Question 1
content: The Compact Disc (CD) was introduced in:
explanation:
Expert Explanation: The 1980s brought MIDI and digital sampling, allowing producers to sequence music on computers. This democratized production, as bedroom studios could now rival expensive analog facilities.

"Digital didn't kill music, it democratized it."
- Home Studio Revolution

expert_quote.text: Digital didn't kill music, it democratized it.
expert_quote.author: Home Studio Revolution

expert_explanation: The 1980s brought MIDI and digital sampling, allowing producers to sequence music on computers. This democratized production, as bedroom studios could now rival expensive analog facilities.

title: Q8: Question 1
content: Streaming platforms like Spotify use what loudness target?
explanation:
Expert Explanation: Modern production relies heavily on the DAW (Digital Audio Workstation). Automation allows producers to draw in changes for volume, pan, and effects parameters over time, creating movement.

"Plugins are tools, not talent."
- Producer Wisdom
expert_explanation: Modern production relies heavily on the DAW (Digital Audio Workstation). Automation allows producers to draw in changes for volume, pan, and effects parameters over time, creating movement.

title: Q9: Question 3
explanation:
Expert Explanation: Rock production focuses on capturing energy. Drums often use 'Room Mics' heavily compressed to create a massive, explosive sound (e.g., Led Zeppelin sounds).

"Microphone bleed is part of the drum sound."
- Steve Albini

expert_quote.text: Microphone bleed is part of the drum sound.
expert_quote.author: Steve Albini

expert_explanation: Rock production focuses on capturing energy. Drums often use 'Room Mics' heavily compressed to create a massive, explosive sound (e.g., Led Zeppelin sounds).

title: Q10: Question 8
explanation:
Expert Explanation: Sidechain compression is a staple of EDM. The kick drum triggers the compressor on the bass/synths, ducking their volume to let the kick punch through and creating a rhythmic 'pumping' effect.

"Sidechain isn't just a effect, it's a rhythmic element."
- Daft Punk Influence

expert_quote.text: Sidechain isn't just a effect, it's a rhythmic element.
expert_quote.author: Daft Punk Influence

expert_explanation: Sidechain compression is a staple of EDM. The kick drum triggers the compressor on the bass/synths, ducking their volume to let the kick punch through and creating a rhythmic 'pumping' effect.
